meanings.sent1: Tom loves to skite about his soccer skills.
meanings.sent2: She always skites about her grades in school.
meanings.sent3: The little boy would skite to his friends about his new toy.
meanings.sent4: The peacock skited proudly, showing off its colorful feathers.
meanings.sent5: The chef would skite about his famous recipe to anyone who would listen.

meanings.definition: A person who boasts or brags
meanings.sent1: Sarah is known as the biggest skite in our class.
meanings.sent2: The skite at the party wouldn't stop talking about himself.
meanings.sent3: The skite at the party made everyone laugh with his tall tales.
meanings.sent4: The skite strutted around the room like a peacock.
meanings.sent5: The skite's stories were as colorful as a rainbow.

meanings.sent1: The skite of the car startled the passengers.
meanings.sent2: The skite of the boat caused the fishing rods to jump.
meanings.sent3: The skite of the elevator made everyone grab onto the railings.
meanings.sent4: The skite of the earthquake shook the entire town.
meanings.sent5: The skite of the roller coaster was thrilling and unexpected.
